title: Nudgewink Released
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130823130442im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Nudgewink_5566.gif)

I started goofing around with these letterforms after looking at a collection of early 60's rock 'n' roll album covers.

Nudgewink's baseline bounces around randomly but if a cap glyph sets high, it's lower case will set low and vice versa. Each glyph has an alternate on the same baseline but with a different weight stress or attitude.

With so many possible combinations, I couldn't figure out how to set up the code for a contextual alternate OT feature. So you have to go in and hand tune the thing.

It's a bit of work but I have found that process fun to play around with.

[Check it out at P22.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20130823130442/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/nudgewink.html)  
Here is the [PDF User Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20130823130442/http:/www.woodardworks.com/Nudgewink_Guide.pdf).
author: Robby Woodard
